We explore the system's response under an integral transformation \\( T(z) = \\int_0^T e^{-i\\omega t}z(t)\\, dt \\), applied over a time interval from 0 to T.

Knowing the outcome of \\( T(z) \\) over the specified interval T, can we infer the exact initial state \\( z_0 \\) of the system, assuming no further information about interventions or initial conditions?

Without distinct initial state information or detailed knowledge of \\( k \\), reconstructing \\( z_0 \\) accurately from \\( T(z) \\) alone is indeterminate due to possible variations in the initial conditions and contributions from \\( k \\).
